core.title: Taichung long-term care transfer APP
core.desc: Providing citizens with the most convenient long-term care transportation service

info.item1: Health Bureau of Taichung City Government
info.item3: UI Design, UX Research, Design System, Prototype

brief.item1: Our company was commissioned by the Taichung City Government to add new features to the existing system, providing citizens with a 'Community Shuttle' service to meet the needs of elderly residents traveling between their homes and long-term care centers.
brief.item2-1: Elderly users can use the app to schedule shuttle services in advance, facilitating convenient travel between their homes and long-term care centers.
brief.item3-1: Since the primary users are elderly individuals, their specific needs must be considered, offering convenient service options tailored to them.
brief.item4-1: The app also includes a driver version, enabling drivers to receive bookings and perform various actions during trips (e.g., check-in upon boarding, marking arrival at destinations, etc.).

briefCard.item1: Expanded the original app with new features to meet the needs of elderly users traveling between their homes and long-term care centers, as well as providing a version for drivers.
briefCard.item2: In this project, I closely collaborated with the PM and engineers. I was responsible for the entire UX and UI design process and deliverables, from defining the problem to delivering the final visual design to the engineers.
briefCard.item3: This project involved adding features to the existing system, requiring designs to align with the original style and user workflows, which imposed additional constraints on the design process.
briefCard.item4: We completed the functionality in phases, ensuring a smooth user experience for both users and drivers. We also improved various features based on user feedback and planned to introduce group booking services in the future.

background.item1: The government is promoting the 'Long-Term Care 2.0 Plan,' which provides diverse care resources through an integrated service model, including home-based, community-based, and institutional care. For many elderly individuals or those with limited mobility, transportation to medical facilities, rehabilitation centers, or day care units remains a significant challenge. This project not only effectively integrates transportation resources but also offers real-time booking, customized services, and care safety features, providing convenient and reliable transportation services for families and the elderly.

goal.item2: Allow users to book shuttle services via the app
goal.item4: Enable drivers to offer shuttle services

problem.item1: New features need to be added to the original system, but the original design files have been lost.
problem.item2: The original system does not include a navigation bar, making it difficult for users to return to the 'Home' page.
problem.item3: Consideration must be given to the usage habits of older adults.
problem.item4: To meet the needs of older adults, more information needs to be displayed while also addressing the display limitations of mobile screens.

sa.item1: Understand the government's regulations on long-term care subsidies
sa.item2: Understand the usage habits of elderly users
sa.item3: Categorize the types of reservation forms
sa.item4: Understand the stages and items to be confirmed during the transportation process

ta.item1: Elderly individuals requiring transportation to and from long-term care centers
ta.item1-1: Elderly individuals needing to use reservation-based transport services to travel between long-term care centers and their homes.
ta.item2-1: Drivers who use the system to confirm reservations and are responsible for transporting clients.

research.item1: How to provide an easy-to-use appointment system for the elderly?
research.item2: How to provide a clear appointment form presentation for drivers?
research.item3: How to help drivers complete each stage of the task?
research.item4: How to view historical appointment forms?

hypo.item1: Provide an interface friendly to elderly users
hypo.item1-1: Considering the needs of elderly users, we enlarged the font size and spacing.
hypo.item2-1: We maintain a consistent format for the forms to enhance readability.
hypo.item3-1: We provide time predictions and dynamic tracking of the driver on the booking form.
hypo.item4-1: The driver must click to complete the current task; the next task cannot be clicked until the previous one is completed.

challenge.item1-1: Increasing the font size and spacing can make the layout information more complex.
challenge.item2-1: A driver may have multiple bookings, and the status of each booking must be clearly distinguished.
challenge.item3-1: The driver may forget to click to complete the task.

principle.item1-1: To continue the original design style, we use the same colors and layout.
principle.item2-1: Considering the target audience is the elderly, we make the visual presentation as large as possible.

system.item1: In this project, I used Figma to establish and manage the design system, enabling a consistent and efficient component development process. The design system covers commonly used UI components, including buttons, forms, cards, and more.

info.item1-1: Use dynamic switching to toggle between different forms, catering to different user registrations while maintaining a unified design and reducing additional development efforts.
info.item2-1: Integrate API data to enable real-time validation, reducing manual review time.
info.item3-1: Place the search function in the Hero section of the homepage, allowing visitors to search for courses or providers instantly, enhancing convenience.
info.item4-1: Showcase the latest three news updates on the website.
info.item5-1: Categorize courses by type to help users quickly find suitable categories.
info.item6-1: Display the latest course reviews from students to provide visitors with feedback on the courses.
info.item7-1: Since most visitors are international students, provide information about Taiwan (transportation, cuisine, attractions, etc.) to help them quickly understand the country.
info.item8-1: With the use of popup design, users can check information at any time on the screen. We also provide popular tags and recommended courses for reference.
info.item9-1: Click the Filter button on the left to collapse the filter, making it easier for users to browse.
info.item10-1: Courses are designed in card format, with key information displayed, allowing users to easily view required items in real time.
info.item11-1: Fix the course information card on the right side, allowing users to click and register for the course anytime while browsing the information on the left.
info.item12-1: Users can instantly switch between information for easy and quick content search.
info.item13-1: Displays the registration stage with a progress bar, dividing the steps to avoid a lengthy filling process.
info.item14-1: Use the 'Add New' button to add members, and a file upload button is also provided to batch add members.
info.item15-1: After clicking the 'Add New' button, the form will slide out from the right side, saving space on the page.
info.item16-1: Provides contact information and consultation button.
info.item17-1: Users can instantly switch between information to browse the unit's introduction, courses, and transportation details.
info.item18-1: Allows toggling to view courses with different registration statuses.
info.item19-1: Presented in a card format, displaying various review statuses and action buttons.
info.item20-1: Click the registration course card to view the details.
info.item21-1: This is a group registration demonstration, where you can check the registration review status of each member.
info.item22-1: Click the consultation button in the lower-right corner to expand the chat window. The units that have conducted the conversation will be listed for easy viewing.
info.item23-1: The chat window allows real-time communication with the course units and supports file uploads.

prototype.item1-1: After logging in, users can access the 'Community Transport' service from the homepage and switch features using the bottom navigation bar. At the top, there is a toggle button for transport services, where users can book rides, view reservations, and check their trip history.
prototype.item2-1: After clicking 'Book a Ride,' users can choose the type of transport. They can prefill the form with frequently used addresses, select the appointment time, specify the number of companions, indicate wheelchair needs, and add remarks before submitting the reservation.
prototype.item3-1: Clicking 'Reserved Trips' allows users to view their scheduled transport services. They can track the driver's status and view detailed information or cancel reservations by clicking on the cards. In 'Trip History,' users can filter by date to view past reservation records.
prototype.item4-1: After logging in, drivers can access the 'Community Transport' service from the homepage. A toggle button at the top allows them to perform pre-trip checks, view task lists, and review trip history. Drivers can clock in for work using the 'Settings' function and clock out after completing services. Clocking in and out multiple times in a day is supported.
prototype.item5-1: In the 'Task List,' drivers can view their current assignments. The task card shows the status of each task in the upper right corner. During a task, drivers need to click 'Start' and proceed through each stage by pressing the corresponding buttons to complete the task. In case of any issues, they can click the 'Exception Button,' select a reason, and mark the task as completed.

handoff.item1: In Figma, I designed different versions of the interface and provided screen annotations to help the development team understand the user operation logic.

feedback.item1-1: This project expanded on an existing one by introducing new features. Without the original design drafts, it was challenging to add new functionalities. I spent significant time recreating the old version and used it as a foundation to design the expanded features for this project, ensuring consistency in the design.
feedback.item2-1: The public and driver versions have completely different operational functionalities. The design needed to be adjusted based on the specific needs of these different user groups.
feedback.item3: Interface Design for Specific User Groups
feedback.item3-1: This project was primarily designed for older adults. By observing their usual habits and gathering user feedback, we adjusted the design to a more suitable presentation while also ensuring usability and convenience.
feedback.item4-1: In a booking and transport service, various unexpected situations may arise. It was necessary to account for all possibilities, provide options for predefined scenarios, and devise solutions for undefined situations.
